Strong sense of digital design and the fundamentals of user experience, including accessibility
Demonstrated problem-solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership
Strong communication skills and ability to articulate complex problems
Bachelor's Degree a related field, or equivalent experience.
2+ year experience with AWS, Containers, Serverless, and infrastructure deployment/management
Unwavering attention to detail and ability to prioritize work across multiple projects
Development experience with RESTful (Middleware) and micro services
Deep understanding of JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS, and the DOM
Master of tools such as package managers, bundlers, pre-processors and, post-processors
Demonstrated understanding of web development patterns, protocols, standards, and best practices
Even Better If You Have
A degree in computer science

Experience with headless CMS platforms and content modeling
Have used Lerna, Styled Components, and Storybook
Experience working on Enterprise Design Systems
Deployed to AWS, Apigee, Kubernetes

Knowledge of Adobe products such as AEM, Test & Target, Analytics, Audience Manager
Some travel to Basking Ridge may be required.

Experience: Minimum 8+ years
Relocation: This position will not cover relocation expenses
Travel: No
Local Preferred: Yes
Recruiter Name: Tarun Garg
Recruiter Phone: 877-884-8834 (Ext: 2188)/412 200 1197 (Ext: 2188)

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"TL;DR

High-impact software development jobs for smart people.

Code that saves lives.

As a software developer at Epic, you\xe2\x80\x99ll write software that impacts the lives of 75% of Americans and 250 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, you\xe2\x80\x99ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, you\xe2\x80\x99ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves.

Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.

All the Top 20 health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.

Work in your own office, eat delicious food, and travel the world.

We don\xe2\x80\x99t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but\xe2\x80\xa6) You will work in an individual office that will heighten your ability to get stuff done. For lunch, visit King\xe2\x80\x99s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they\xe2\x80\x99re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you\xe2\x80\x99ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyonc\xc3\xa9 concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.

Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.

Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States and home to the state capital and the University of Wisconsin. Madison, a city surrounded by water, has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madison\xe2\x80\x99s first arcade bar.

More than just important work.

We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action (W/M/Vets/Disability) employer. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.

Requirements

Open to relocation to the Madison, WI area (we will bring you here to explore the city for yourself)
BS/BA or greater in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
A history of academic excellence or professional success
Eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship (persons with appropriate qualifications and eligible for TN status under NAFTA may apply)"

title: b'Web Application Developer'
job description:
b"What You Will Be Doing at WebMD
WebMD has updated its entire technology stack and you will be working the latest and most cutting edge technology. We are seeking a motivated, talented and spirited Web Application Developer to join our close-knit team of talented professionals dedicated to building and enhancing WebMD\xe2\x80\x99s next generation product portfolio, to include WebMD\xe2\x80\x99s enterprise web applications and WebMD Mobile. We are seeking motivated engineers who are natural leaders to bring a fresh perspective and who thrive in collaborative team settings and want to learn with opportunities to work server-side development. This is a unique opportunity to impact and inspire ground-breaking product ideas with the latest in web technologies.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Be Doing at WebMD
Be part of a collaborative, friendly, and open environment with a team that offers high level exposure.

Project responsibilities include development, testing, documentation, implementation, and maintenance

Actively contribute to and enforce best practices, group standards
Mentor other developers, including peer reviewing code and pair programming (shadowing)
Proactively keep up-to-date on industry trends and emerging technologies; drive adoption of new technologies and best practices

What's In It For You
Besides a competitive compensation package, you'll be working with a great group of technologists interested in always finding the right tool for the job in a culture that encourages innovation.  If you're ready to take on some new technical challenges at a well-respected company, we'd love to hear from you.

3+ years of experience delivering large scale web applications
3+ years of Javascript/HTML/CSS development experience, VueJS is highly preferred.

Experience with basic jQuery, including writing modules
Experience developing Responsive, multiscreen (desktop/tablet/mobile) layouts with HTML5/CSS3/VueJS.
Experience programming using RESTful APIs.

... and if you have the following, even better! (preferred qualifications)
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in a technical discipline or equivalent work experience
CommonJS/AMD modules with RequireJS or equivalent
VueJS or another equivalent Javascript framework
Agile development practices: Scrum, Kanban/Lean, test-driven development, continuous integration
Version control software, preferably Git
Section 508 and WCAG accessibility standards
Must provide code samples (examples: URLs with descriptions of which parts you developed, zip file, link to a github.com or equivalent profile)

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b'Join the A.I. company tackling some of the most consequential problems facing the world today. Gro Intelligence is a fast-growing, mission-driven data and analytics company dedicated to understanding the interconnected global markets for all agricultural products. From the food we eat to the clothing we wear and the gasoline in millions of cars across the globe, agriculture touches our daily existence like few other industries. And it\xe2\x80\x99s being completely upended by climate change, trade wars, finite global resources, fickle public policies, a growing population and ever-changing human tastes (e.g. organic produce, plant-based proteins, etc). Come help us understand the complex interplay of these various forces and their ripple effect on global markets.

With offices in both New York and Nairobi, and the financial backing of prominent investors including TPG Growth and Data Collective, Gro is a diverse team of more than 70 technologists, scientists, and business professionals. Our team is growing rapidly and we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for highly motivated, intellectually curious individuals with a shared commitment to building software that impacts the world on the most basic level.

Gro has been featured prominently alongside the company\xe2\x80\x99s founder and CEO in several recent outlets including Recode Decode with Kara Swisher, Fast Company\xe2\x80\x99s Most Creative People, Fortune\xe2\x80\x99s Most Powerful Women in Business, and Vanity Fair\xe2\x80\x99s Inside the Hive with Nick Bilton.

Gro is looking to bring on a web developer to keep building and optimizing Gro\xe2\x80\x99s website. This developer will join us to make our web properties more accessible and successful to serve current customers and attract potential clients.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Create responsive, mobile-friendly web experiences for the gro-intelligence.com website and other Gro web properties.
Write well-designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices.
Work with the Product Managers, UI and UX designers to ensure Gro\xe2\x80\x99s web properties are optimized for high conversions and a delightful user experience.
Integrate with CRMs and inbound marketing systems when necessary for promotional, and informational strategies.
Integrate with web analytics tools to track conversion performance.


What You Have
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science, HCI, Design, or equivalent practical experience
Proficient in HTML5 and CSS3
Experience with web libraries and frameworks, such as jQuery, React, AngularJS
Experience with server-side javascript (e.g Node.js) and frameworks such as Express.js, Hapi.js. Familiar with MVC concept.
Experience using RESTful APIs
Be knowledgeable of best practices for and able to produce high-quality web application UX and UI
Conversant with analytics tools such as HubSpot, Google Analytics, or Mixpanel
2 years related working experience


Bonus Points
Experience with SEO
Experience designing and developing highly interactive web pages
Knowledge of databases such as Postgres, MongoDB
Python, Go, C++, Java
Portfolio is a plus


Gro Intelligence is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.'

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"Who We Are

Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Seamless, HBO, Disney, Urban Outfitters, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale \xe2\x80\x93 each month, tens of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 2 billion active users through Braze.

Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms in 2019. The company has also been named on the Forbes Cloud 100, Inc. Magazine\xe2\x80\x99s 2019 Best Places to Work, and Crain's 2019 Best Places to Work in NYC lists.

What We're Looking For

Braze is looking for a skilled web developer to help grow our MarTech and Ops team. This person will play an integral role in developing and executing on marketing tactics to not only drive revenue, but enrich the web experience for visitors to Braze.com. This role will own the full development lifecycle and continually build and optimize both the frontend and backend of the website.

A key part of the Demand Generation team, you will execute on direct outputs from the marketing strategy and implement strategic iterations to Braze.com in an effort to create better pipeline-driving experiences for our prospects and customers. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a developer that loves to mix their passion for web development with a desire for pushing web analytics and marketing tech to the next level.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Help to lead the transformation of Braze.com\xe2\x80\x99s 2020 new website redesign!
Our CMS is built on Craft and you\xe2\x80\x99ll be creating scalable page templates to leverage in our marketing programs.
Contribute to website development with a highly technical approach around analytics, SEO optimization, and delivery of quality traffic to the website
Test & optimize our site to increase stickiness and increase conversions.
Streamline and build scalable templates for our content management infrastructure to empower the marketing team to use the website
Partner with stakeholders across the organization to scope new web page or section needs and develop a plan for evaluating asks.
Create attention-grabbing experiences by helping to identify emerging trends, and working to implement them as appropriate across our marketing properties.
Manage Google Analytics and set up dashboards and custom events to monitor and analyze site performance and provide recommendations for content updates or areas of optimization.
Leverage optimization and AB testing tools such as Optimizely to regularly test and optimize site. Recommend new tools where appropriate.


Who You Are

You have a deep understanding of what it takes to manage a website including minimizing technical debt, maintaining SEO best practices, and finding the simplest way to achieve complex and high impact problems.
5+ years of experience
Deep expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML5 , CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, PHP, and API's.
Knowledge of Craft CMS and Google Analytics
Comfortable with JavaScript libraries (React, jQuery), JavaScript module loaders (RequireJS), templating languages, Github
Working knowledge of Node, unit testing, a/b testing - we use Optimizely
Strong communicator and experience working on a marketing team
Familiarity in building high performance responsive websites
Prior experience working with professional design teams


What We Offer
Competitive compensation that includes equity
Flexible time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave
Free daily lunch, including snacks and beverages
Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture

In addition, this position is exempt under the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act.

If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights."

title: b'Web Developer (Mid-Level)'
job description:
b'Web Developer (Mid-Level)

Manhattan Prep\xe2\x80\x99s developers create the next-generation technologies which have changed how hundreds of thousands learn, making accessible and useful the Manhattan Prep curriculum and coursework. Our ambitions reach far beyond just test preparation to engineer exceptional learning experiences for millions of future students.

As a Web Developer at Manhattan Prep, you live on the front lines of the education revolution (making quality education accessible to more students) and build features used by thousands of people every day. The work is challenging, fast paced and always changing. Strong analytical skills, unwavering commitment to quality, collaborative work ethic and cutting edge coding skills are all required.

You will be given substantial responsibility with room for professional growth. If you seek a challenging, exciting, and creative programming role \xe2\x80\x94 while working with talented and passionate people \xe2\x80\x94 this might be the position for you. Must work in NYC.

As a Web Developer You Will
Participate in the architecture, design, and implementation of educational applications, products and company business systems.
Work within a team of talented developers to design workflows and mentor team members while setting an example.
Participate in the design and development of new features and products, including requirements gathering, estimating, coding, testing, developing test plans and maintenance schedules.
Communicate status of projects/applications and give accurate data forecasts for projects and work items.
Take initiative in problem solving and demonstrate advanced problem awareness.
Work in an agile environment that facilitates ideation across all product development teams.
Tackle the tough problems of integrating complex systems across internal business units.

Skills & Requirements
5+ years of web development/architecture experience.
Deep experience with Ruby, Javascript and related frameworks.
Experience with object oriented, data-driven design and development.
Familiarity with using a relational and non-relational databases.
Design, develop and maintain new features on existing applications and systems.
Confidence with distributed version control systems (Git).
Develop domain expertise by working closely with dev team and product managers.
Self-motivated, quick learner who can manage multiple projects and developers with minimal direction.

How To Impress Us
Show us a web app you created independently from start to finish.
Show us open source projects you\xe2\x80\x99ve worked on (with tested code).
Show us an awesome portfolio.
Talk to us about how you write clean code.
Talk to us about how you\xe2\x80\x99ve scaled an app.

What We Offer
Competitive Salary, plus individual and company performance bonuses.
Medical, Dental, Life and Disability Insurance.
401K Savings Plan + company matching.
Exciting location and office environment.
Free Employee Prep Class (GMAT, GRE or LSAT).
Family Discount on Manhattan Prep Classes.
An incredible team of smart and supportive people.
And more!

About Manhattan Prep

Manhattan Prep is a fast-growing education organization headquartered in New York City. A market leader in test preparation, Manhattan Prep is the preferred test prep provider for corporate clients including Google, Goldman Sachs, Deloitte, McKinsey, Accenture, and others. We conduct in-person classes and private instruction across the United States, Canada, and the UK, and our Live Online courses, digital learning resources, and print books are available worldwide.'

title: b'Web Designer & Developer'
job description:

Job Scope

The client is seeking a Web Designer & Developer to relaunch a website based off Squarespace or Wordpress, and integrated it to its CRM.
The web designer & developer will be responsible for the design, layout, and coding of the website. The talent will be involved with the technical and graphical aspects of a website - how the site works and how it looks. They can also be involved with the maintenance and update of an existing site.

Good interpersonal and communication skills.

Interested applicants may send a copy of their updated CV to careers@content.co.

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b'Role Overview

The Web Developer is an integral piece of the QB puzzle. We re looking for someone who is passionate about web development, well versed in current dev trends, and excited to shape web experiences from the ground up. Working closely with the graphic design, strategy, photography, and social teams, you ll be challenged to think differently, develop and evolve brand experiences through exciting and engaging web experiences to make sure sites are user friendly and innovative. Depending on the project, you will be responsible for building websites from scratch, maintaining and updating existing sites, or consulting internal and external teams on web best practices. As a member of the design team, you will be a key driver behind the web experiences QB produces and will own the web development arm of our agency.

The Web Developer is a full time position at the agency and reports to the Art Director.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve websites.
Develop and customize elements on new and existing WordPress websites.
Collaborate with graphic design team to build modern, visually appealing, creative websites within WordPress.
Manipulate a comprehensive library of WordPress themes and plugins given the project specifications.
Produce original website / mobile site layouts and execute layout revisions to them in a rapid and accurate manner.
Build products aligned to help our clients succeed in the industry
Troubleshoot advanced PHP, MySQL, and CSS issues related to WordPress websites.
Troubleshoot issues across variety of domain, server, hosting, and CMS platforms/setups.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
Be extremely organized in communicating with internal Project Managers, following detailed instructions, and working within out proprietary CRM, effectively and efficiently.
Keep up with current web development technologies and trends while finding ways to incorporate them in our work

Requirements
Minimum Bachelor s Degree in Software Engineering/Web Development or related field
5+ years experience building responsive websites across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers
Advanced proficiency in HTML, CSS, WordPress, PHP, Illustrator, Photoshop , and XD.
Portfolio containing at least five completed/published WordPress websites.
3-5 years in professional commercial design, preferably with a marketing or creative agency OR relevant work experience as a Web Developer (or similar role)
Proven experience with Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign, specifically with mockups, web design and multimedia presentation
Experience working with WordPress and similar website templates
Experienced with back-end programming languages (node.js, ruby, Python, Smalltalk).
Experience using front-end technologies (Javascript, HTML, CSS, Vue.js).
Understanding of security and data protocols.
Demonstrated familiarity with ADA guidelines
Demonstrated ability working on, and optimizing for, SEO
Demonstrated ability to implement or suggest treatments that improve user experience
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed
Strong communication skills and great product sense
Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements.
Willingness to work collaboratively and in a small team environment.
Ability to absorb and apply constructive criticism from peers and clients
Motivated, organized, and flexible.

Serious inquiries from candidates interested in a full-time salaried position only, please provide resume and portfolio links.

Associated topics: ajax, css2, css3, ecmascript, front end, javascript, jquery, reactjs, web application programmer, web design'

title: b'Web Developer - User Experience Products'
job description:
b"Digital Strategy\xe2\x80\x99s Products team is responsible for building and delivering the tools which power the firm's revamped intranet and award-winning public website.

The team is seeking an experienced full stack Web developer to focus on extending and expanding the firm's intranet and blogging platforms, as well as the corporate website. The primary application stack---a microservices architecture comprising modern homegrown and open-source components---is defining and delivering a newly redesigned Web experience for stakeholders across the firm and the world.

How You Will Fulfill Your Potential

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
The right candidate will use their experience to help us build a high quality web experience which delights our users. Leveraging expert knowledge, modern frameworks, and partnering with our developers and designers, he/she will deliver best in class solutions which will ultimately enhance our employees experience and productivity.
The ideal candidate would be a highly-motivated self-starter for the group's front-end application development activities, as well as serving as a thought leader for cross-team projects and the team's developer-outreach activities.

Skills And Experience We Are Looking For
Expertise in Web display technologies, particularly modern JavaScript libraries frameworks (e.g., React/Redux, Angular, Backbone/Marionette), CSS (including experience with SASS, LESS, and/or PostCSS), and HTML. Demonstrated experience implementing a scalable, responsive website or web application is a strong plus.
Back-end development skills, ideally in Java or a similar OO language.
Working knowledge of databases (NoSQL and/or relational), RESTful service architectures, and Web architecture components (e.g., NGINX, Varnish, Apache, etc.)
Experience collaborating with Web designers or working within the constraints of a specifically designed Website. Candidates should understand how a site functions visually, be able to execute new functionality within a design's grammar, and show the capability to spot and correct visual defects.

Preferred Qualifications
Strong communication skills, including experience working with other development teams and business users.
Prior experience working with content management systems (e.g., Craft, Drupal etc.,) and content-driven website development.
Experience coding accessible websites (particularly experience with Semantic HTML5 and/or WCAG Compliance).
Knowledge of modern JavaScript language constructs and variants (e.g., ES6/7, TypeScript, etc.).
Experience with front-end build pipelines and tools (e.g., Grunt, Gulp, WebPack)
Hands-on experience with Node.js.

About Goldman Sachs

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. title: b'Fullstack Web Developer'
location: b'New York, New York, United States'
job description:
b'Fullstack Web Developer

Saggezza is a proven technology and consulting partner that delivers personalized, high-value solutions to accelerate business growth. We Consult, create Experiences, Analyze, Modernize and Digitize to help our clients adapt and transform the way they do business. Saggezza consultants work as part of a global team, and throughout their tenure, have the opportunity to work on a variety of different projects across various clients and industries. We are chartered to do one thing, and one thing only \xe2\x80\x93 to bring enabling technology to our clients that allows them to move their business forward.

The Role

As part of our global team you will work on various components as a Software Engineer. Your role includes specification, development, as well as the testing and rollout of new features. You are expected to contribute to the vision, understand our product roadmap, integrate business value with experience and contribute to building an engineering culture within the team. We expect the successful candidate to deliver high quality software and to be passionate about software engineering. You must have a proficient understanding of software development concepts. A good understanding of Cloud concepts is a plus. You will also be responsible to develop easy to support software and liaise with our SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) team to factor in their requirements.

We are looking for a Senior Web Engineer to lead a team of developers who translate UI/UX design wireframes into actual code that will produce the visual elements of the application. Working with the UI/UX design, you will be heavily involved in the design process and will provide the technical implementation of the resulting looks and behavior. In addition, you will work very closely with our service developers to contribute to design and implementation of the full stack.
  What You Will Definitely Need

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in computer science, engineering, information systems
Minimum of 8+years (3+ years Java or Node.JS., 2yrs in ReactJS Framework, 5+ years JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3; 3+ years GIT Execute against product strategy to buildout our digital client servicing strategy
Experience in delivery of business solutions using custom developed software across the full stack, both hands-on and in team leadership roles
Comfort with Agile operating models
Experience creating reusable custom web controls or visualizations (beyond third-party libraries)
Knowledge of frequent deployment practices such as Blue/Green, Exposure to HTTP/TCP network protocols, Financial Services or Fintech, Exposure to Mobile-based applications, Advanced CSS styling, SVGs, and animation, Sketch or Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator *AWS, Adobe, & Microservices preferred but not mandatory

What We\xe2\x80\x99d Love to See

Team-oriented
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Energetic, self-directed and self-motivated
Independent and comfortable in a fast-paced, ambiguous and often multi- directional work environment

Don\xe2\x80\x99t tick all the boxes? Don\xe2\x80\x99t worry about it: we still want to hear from you if you think you\xe2\x80\x99re the right person for the job.

What Makes Saggezza Unique?

Strong Relationships: We take the time to know our clients well, from the way they do business to their culture and their unique pain points. This level of engagement enables us to develop highly effective solutions.

Clients First: We work to understand our clients then develop a unique point of view to address their pain points. We do whatever it takes to provide the right solutions to address their specific situation.

A Trusted Partner: We collaborate as a true strategic partner and work side-by-side to develop the best solutions to bring our clients\xe2\x80\x99 businesses into the future.

Passionate Mindset: We have an unending passion for technology and teamwork. We develop highly effective solutions to help our clients tackle the complex digital landscape.

Creating Value: The right investment in digital change is critical for our clients. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we develop personalized, highly effective solutions that deliver value for their businesses.

Delivery Excellence: Our proven processes provide high-quality solutions that are delivered on time.

Why Join Our Team

Our culture is diverse with endless opportunities to work for global corporations in their own backyard.
Our nurturing and supportive environment fosters collaboration across the entire organization.
We are not hierarchical but operate as a flat surface where every opinion matters, ideas are cultivated and innovation is encouraged.
At Saggezza, we are fortunate to have a strong mentorship program that provides each and every one of our consultants the ability to thrive professionally and personally.
We are only as good as our people. Saggezza, Italian for wisdom, is rooted from the perspective that knowledge is power. We create thoughtleaders who are constantly exposed and trained in different technologies in the ever-evolving world of software development.
We welcome all types of innovators with an entrepreneurial spirit to grow with our team.

Saggezza is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity. We base our employment decisions on merit, experience, and potential, without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local law.
 '

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"TL;DR

High-impact software development jobs for smart people.

Code that saves lives.

As a software developer at Epic, you\xe2\x80\x99ll write software that impacts the lives of 75% of Americans and 250 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, you\xe2\x80\x99ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, you\xe2\x80\x99ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves.

Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.

All the Top 20 health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.

Work in your own office, eat delicious food, and travel the world.

We don\xe2\x80\x99t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but\xe2\x80\xa6) You will work in an individual office that will heighten your ability to get stuff done. For lunch, visit King\xe2\x80\x99s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they\xe2\x80\x99re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you\xe2\x80\x99ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyonc\xc3\xa9 concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.

Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.

Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States and home to the state capital and the University of Wisconsin. Madison, a city surrounded by water, has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madison\xe2\x80\x99s first arcade bar.

More than just important work.

We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action (W/M/Vets/Disability) employer. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.

Requirements

Open to relocation to the Madison, WI area (we will bring you here to explore the city for yourself)
BS/BA or greater in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
A history of academic excellence or professional success
Eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship (persons with appropriate qualifications and eligible for TN status under NAFTA may apply)"

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b'Join the A.I. company tackling some of the most consequential problems facing the world today. Gro Intelligence is a fast-growing, mission-driven data and analytics company dedicated to understanding the interconnected global markets for all agricultural products. From the food we eat to the clothing we wear and the gasoline in millions of cars across the globe, agriculture touches our daily existence like few other industries. And it\xe2\x80\x99s being completely upended by climate change, trade wars, finite global resources, fickle public policies, a growing population and ever-changing human tastes (e.g. organic produce, plant-based proteins, etc). Come help us understand the complex interplay of these various forces and their ripple effect on global markets.

With offices in both New York and Nairobi, and the financial backing of prominent investors including TPG Growth and Data Collective, Gro is a diverse team of more than 70 technologists, scientists, and business professionals. Our team is growing rapidly and we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for highly motivated, intellectually curious individuals with a shared commitment to building software that impacts the world on the most basic level.

Gro has been featured prominently alongside the company\xe2\x80\x99s founder and CEO in several recent outlets including Recode Decode with Kara Swisher, Fast Company\xe2\x80\x99s Most Creative People, Fortune\xe2\x80\x99s Most Powerful Women in Business, and Vanity Fair\xe2\x80\x99s Inside the Hive with Nick Bilton.

Gro is looking to bring on a web developer to keep building and optimizing Gro\xe2\x80\x99s website. This developer will join us to make our web properties more accessible and successful to serve current customers and attract potential clients.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Create responsive, mobile-friendly web experiences for the gro-intelligence.com website and other Gro web properties.
Write well-designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices.
Work with the Product Managers, UI and UX designers to ensure Gro\xe2\x80\x99s web properties are optimized for high conversions and a delightful user experience.
Integrate with CRMs and inbound marketing systems when necessary for promotional, and informational strategies.
Integrate with web analytics tools to track conversion performance.


What You Have

Experience designing and developing highly interactive web pages

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"Who We Are

Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Seamless, HBO, Disney, Urban Outfitters, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale \xe2\x80\x93 each month, tens of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 2 billion active users through Braze.

Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms in 2019. The company has also been named on the Forbes Cloud 100, Inc. Magazine\xe2\x80\x99s 2019 Best Places to Work, and Crain's 2019 Best Places to Work in NYC lists.

What We're Looking For

Braze is looking for a skilled web developer to help grow our MarTech and Ops team. This person will play an integral role in developing and executing on marketing tactics to not only drive revenue, but enrich the web experience for visitors to Braze.com. This role will own the full development lifecycle and continually build and optimize both the frontend and backend of the website.

A key part of the Demand Generation team, you will execute on direct outputs from the marketing strategy and implement strategic iterations to Braze.com in an effort to create better pipeline-driving experiences for our prospects and customers. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a developer that loves to mix their passion for web development with a desire for pushing web analytics and marketing tech to the next level.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Help to lead the transformation of Braze.com\xe2\x80\x99s 2020 new website redesign!
Our CMS is built on Craft and you\xe2\x80\x99ll be creating scalable page templates to leverage in our marketing programs.
Contribute to website development with a highly technical approach around analytics, SEO optimization, and delivery of quality traffic to the website
Test & optimize our site to increase stickiness and increase conversions.
Streamline and build scalable templates for our content management infrastructure to empower the marketing team to use the website
Partner with stakeholders across the organization to scope new web page or section needs and develop a plan for evaluating asks.
Create attention-grabbing experiences by helping to identify emerging trends, and working to implement them as appropriate across our marketing properties.
Manage Google Analytics and set up dashboards and custom events to monitor and analyze site performance and provide recommendations for content updates or areas of optimization.
Leverage optimization and AB testing tools such as Optimizely to regularly test and optimize site. Recommend new tools where appropriate.


Who You Are

You have a deep understanding of what it takes to manage a website including minimizing technical debt, maintaining SEO best practices, and finding the simplest way to achieve complex and high impact problems.
5+ years of experience
Deep expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML5 , CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, PHP, and API's.
Knowledge of Craft CMS and Google Analytics
Comfortable with JavaScript libraries (React, jQuery), JavaScript module loaders (RequireJS), templating languages, Github
Working knowledge of Node, unit testing, a/b testing - we use Optimizely
Strong communicator and experience working on a marketing team
Familiarity in building high performance responsive websites
Prior experience working with professional design teams


What We Offer
Competitive compensation that includes equity
Flexible time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave
Free daily lunch, including snacks and beverages
Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture

In addition, this position is exempt under the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act.

If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights."

title: b'Web Developer (Mid-Level)'
job description:
b'Web Developer (Mid-Level)

Manhattan Prep\xe2\x80\x99s developers create the next-generation technologies which have changed how hundreds of thousands learn, making accessible and useful the Manhattan Prep curriculum and coursework. Our ambitions reach far beyond just test preparation to engineer exceptional learning experiences for millions of future students.

As a Web Developer at Manhattan Prep, you live on the front lines of the education revolution (making quality education accessible to more students) and build features used by thousands of people every day. The work is challenging, fast paced and always changing. Strong analytical skills, unwavering commitment to quality, collaborative work ethic and cutting edge coding skills are all required.

You will be given substantial responsibility with room for professional growth. If you seek a challenging, exciting, and creative programming role \xe2\x80\x94 while working with talented and passionate people \xe2\x80\x94 this might be the position for you. Must work in NYC.

As a Web Developer You Will
Participate in the architecture, design, and implementation of educational applications, products and company business systems.
Work within a team of talented developers to design workflows and mentor team members while setting an example.
Participate in the design and development of new features and products, including requirements gathering, estimating, coding, testing, developing test plans and maintenance schedules.
Communicate status of projects/applications and give accurate data forecasts for projects and work items.
Take initiative in problem solving and demonstrate advanced problem awareness.
Work in an agile environment that facilitates ideation across all product development teams.
Tackle the tough problems of integrating complex systems across internal business units.

Skills & Requirements
5+ years of web development/architecture experience.
Deep experience with Ruby, Javascript and related frameworks.
Experience with object oriented, data-driven design and development.
Familiarity with using a relational and non-relational databases.
Design, develop and maintain new features on existing applications and systems.
Confidence with distributed version control systems (Git).
Develop domain expertise by working closely with dev team and product managers.
Self-motivated, quick learner who can manage multiple projects and developers with minimal direction.

How To Impress Us
Show us a web app you created independently from start to finish.
Show us open source projects you\xe2\x80\x99ve worked on (with tested code).
Show us an awesome portfolio.
Talk to us about how you write clean code.
Talk to us about how you\xe2\x80\x99ve scaled an app.

What We Offer
Competitive Salary, plus individual and company performance bonuses.
Medical, Dental, Life and Disability Insurance.
401K Savings Plan + company matching.
Exciting location and office environment.
Free Employee Prep Class (GMAT, GRE or LSAT).
Family Discount on Manhattan Prep Classes.
An incredible team of smart and supportive people.
And more!

About Manhattan Prep

Manhattan Prep is a fast-growing education organization headquartered in New York City. A market leader in test preparation, Manhattan Prep is the preferred test prep provider for corporate clients including Google, Goldman Sachs, Deloitte, McKinsey, Accenture, and others. We conduct in-person classes and private instruction across the United States, Canada, and the UK, and our Live Online courses, digital learning resources, and print books are available worldwide.'

G3 Technologies, Inc. is a dynamic company providing state-of-the-art wireless technology solutions, specializing in software development, cellular technology, wireless protocols, signal processing and systems integration. The atmosphere is fast-paced and agile, shifting rapidly to meet the pressing needs of our customers. Team mentality, excellent work ethic, initiative, innovation, and an entrepreneurial spirit are key factors to your success here.

title: b'Web Designer & Developer'
job description:
b'Content.co is a next-generation platform for brands such as Expedia, Stripe, and Unilever to work with top creative and digital freelancers. Our talent network has a track record of providing businesses with innovative industry-first solutions to address their diverse needs. Our investors include US-based Plug & Play Tech Center and Singapore Press Holdings.

We are looking for motivated and driven individuals who can bring fresh ideas from all areas and have the aptitude to take on challenging roles to join our growing team. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment with great learning opportunities as a Web Designer & Developer, we encourage you to apply.

Job Scope

The client is seeking a Web Designer & Developer to relaunch a website based off Squarespace or Wordpress, and integrated it to its CRM.
The web designer & developer will be responsible for the design, layout, and coding of the website. The talent will be involved with the technical and graphical aspects of a website - how the site works and how it looks. They can also be involved with the maintenance and update of an existing site.
After establishing the target audience for a website and identifying the type of content it will host, the web designer & developer will:
Write the programming code, either from scratch or by adapting existing website software and graphics packages to meet business requirements.
Test the website and identify any technical problems.
Upload the site onto a server and register it with different search engines.

Requirements
Skills in software programming and graphics.
Give guidance on layout, colors, and styles.
Establish the purpose of the website based upon its target audience.
Identify the type of content the site will host.
Be adaptable and able to pick up new techniques.
Determine any functionality that the site must support, for example, whether it will handle financial transactions or inquiries.
Be aware of international web standards and protocols.
Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Be able to work on their own or in a team.
Be able to work on tight deadlines.
Be thorough and precise in their work.
Be able to multitask.
Be able to use their initiative.
Interested applicants may send a copy of their updated CV to careers@content.co.

You will also serve as the team\xe2\x80\x99s cloud engineer by administering and managing our AIA AWS infrastructure. title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b'Role Overview

The Web Developer is an integral piece of the QB puzzle. We re looking for someone who is passionate about web development, well versed in current dev trends, and excited to shape web experiences from the ground up. Working closely with the graphic design, strategy, photography, and social teams, you ll be challenged to think differently, develop and evolve brand experiences through exciting and engaging web experiences to make sure sites are user friendly and innovative. Depending on the project, you will be responsible for building websites from scratch, maintaining and updating existing sites, or consulting internal and external teams on web best practices. As a member of the design team, you will be a key driver behind the web experiences QB produces and will own the web development arm of our agency.

The Web Developer is a full time position at the agency and reports to the Art Director.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve websites.
Develop and customize elements on new and existing WordPress websites.
Collaborate with graphic design team to build modern, visually appealing, creative websites within WordPress.
Manipulate a comprehensive library of WordPress themes and plugins given the project specifications.
Produce original website / mobile site layouts and execute layout revisions to them in a rapid and accurate manner.
Build products aligned to help our clients succeed in the industry
Troubleshoot advanced PHP, MySQL, and CSS issues related to WordPress websites.
Troubleshoot issues across variety of domain, server, hosting, and CMS platforms/setups.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
Be extremely organized in communicating with internal Project Managers, following detailed instructions, and working within out proprietary CRM, effectively and efficiently.
Keep up with current web development technologies and trends while finding ways to incorporate them in our work

Requirements
Minimum Bachelor s Degree in Software Engineering/Web Development or related field
5+ years experience building responsive websites across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers
Advanced proficiency in HTML, CSS, WordPress, PHP, Illustrator, Photoshop , and XD.
Portfolio containing at least five completed/published WordPress websites.
3-5 years in professional commercial design, preferably with a marketing or creative agency OR relevant work experience as a Web Developer (or similar role)
Proven experience with Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign, specifically with mockups, web design and multimedia presentation
Experience working with WordPress and similar website templates
Experienced with back-end programming languages (node.js, ruby, Python, Smalltalk).
Experience using front-end technologies (Javascript, HTML, CSS, Vue.js).
Understanding of security and data protocols.
Demonstrated familiarity with ADA guidelines
Demonstrated ability working on, and optimizing for, SEO
Demonstrated ability to implement or suggest treatments that improve user experience
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed
Strong communication skills and great product sense
Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements.
Willingness to work collaboratively and in a small team environment.
Ability to absorb and apply constructive criticism from peers and clients
Motivated, organized, and flexible.

Serious inquiries from candidates interested in a full-time salaried position only, please provide resume and portfolio links.

Associated topics: ajax, css2, css3, ecmascript, front end, javascript, jquery, reactjs, web application programmer, web design'

title: b'Web Developer - User Experience Products'
job description:
b"Digital Strategy\xe2\x80\x99s Products team is responsible for building and delivering the tools which power the firm's revamped intranet and award-winning public website.

The team is seeking an experienced full stack Web developer to focus on extending and expanding the firm's intranet and blogging platforms, as well as the corporate website. The primary application stack---a microservices architecture comprising modern homegrown and open-source components---is defining and delivering a newly redesigned Web experience for stakeholders across the firm and the world.

How You Will Fulfill Your Potential

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
The right candidate will use their experience to help us build a high quality web experience which delights our users. Leveraging expert knowledge, modern frameworks, and partnering with our developers and designers, he/she will deliver best in class solutions which will ultimately enhance our employees experience and productivity.
The ideal candidate would be a highly-motivated self-starter for the group's front-end application development activities, as well as serving as a thought leader for cross-team projects and the team's developer-outreach activities.

Skills And Experience We Are Looking For
Expertise in Web display technologies, particularly modern JavaScript libraries frameworks (e.g., React/Redux, Angular, Backbone/Marionette), CSS (including experience with SASS, LESS, and/or PostCSS), and HTML. Demonstrated experience implementing a scalable, responsive website or web application is a strong plus.
Back-end development skills, ideally in Java or a similar OO language.
Working knowledge of databases (NoSQL and/or relational), RESTful service architectures, and Web architecture components (e.g., NGINX, Varnish, Apache, etc.)
Experience collaborating with Web designers or working within the constraints of a specifically designed Website. Candidates should understand how a site functions visually, be able to execute new functionality within a design's grammar, and show the capability to spot and correct visual defects.

Preferred Qualifications
Strong communication skills, including experience working with other development teams and business users.
Prior experience working with content management systems (e.g., Craft, Drupal etc.,) and content-driven website development.
Experience coding accessible websites (particularly experience with Semantic HTML5 and/or WCAG Compliance).
Knowledge of modern JavaScript language constructs and variants (e.g., ES6/7, TypeScript, etc.).
Experience with front-end build pipelines and tools (e.g., Grunt, Gulp, WebPack)
Hands-on experience with Node.js.

About Goldman Sachs

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. title: b'Full Stack Web Developer'
job description:
b"Why American Express?

There\xe2\x80\x99s a difference between having a job and making a difference.

American Express has been making a difference in people\xe2\x80\x99s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.

We\xe2\x80\x99ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they\xe2\x80\x99re ready to take on a new career path, we\xe2\x80\x99re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.

Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.

The powerful backing of American Express.

Don\xe2\x80\x99t make a difference without it.

Don\xe2\x80\x99t live life without it.

At American Express we pride ourselves on being the world leader in customer service. The desire to care for our customers is the same attitude we have when solving for the needs of our colleagues and partners.

The Marketing Applications Platform Excellence team develops applications and systems that power global campaign delivery for American Express. We are looking for creative web application developers to join our team to contribute toward the shared success of our company.

As a member of our team you will create full stack web applications with an emphasis on quality, usability, and innovation. You will need to practice empathy for our internal users by understanding their needs and solving for them in new and imaginative ways.

Do you want to help us become a better team?

What To Expect

Minimum Qualifications
Deliver features for end-to-end web application development on a multi-functional team
Learn how to build applications using our in-house framework
Collaborate with product owners to understand business needs and participate in grooming stories
Embrace code review, pair programming, and process refinement to better yourself and the team
Increase the confidence in our deployments by writing tests and contribute to reliability frameworks
Investigate and resolve production issues with the help of our site reliability team
Innovate and implement new technologies in an effort to improve our team and applications

Join Us If You
Have at least 1+ years of experience in Web Development
Proficient with front end frameworks and state management similar to React.js / Redux
Have experience with modern JavaScript coding, open source ecosystem, and development practices
Are comfortable working in an environment based on Agile development methodologies and DevOps principles
Take initiative to collaborate with others in order to find solutions to the team's problems
Want to join a team that is always trying to improve and grow!
ReqID: 20000755
Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-time
Date Posted: Mar 18, 2020, 9:39:44 PM"

We need someone with a strong understanding of current web design trends and technologies. If you know Photoshop, Adobe illustrator, Indesign, HTML, and CSS, this could be the perfect job. We are in Long Branch, New Jersey, next to the NJT train station, near Pier Village, and Garden State Parkway exit 105.

Our family of companies has experienced significant growth over the past 6 years and currently has 43 employees, a well stocked inventory area and well over twenty five million dollars in sales. Our strong internet presence is complemented by our customer service and sales support. We pride ourselves with our product knowledge, strong phone support and speedy customer service.

2012 marked the third consecutive year we were named to the Internet Retailers Top 500 companies list. We have also been listed on Inc. Magazines top 5000 list in 2009 as well as in the Top 100 of NJ companies.

One can find us exhibiting at major regional and national trade shows like NJEA and NECC. We believe it is important that people see the friendly faces that represent our company.'

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"TL;DR

High-impact software development jobs for smart people.

Code that saves lives.

As a software developer at Epic, you\xe2\x80\x99ll write software that impacts the lives of 75% of Americans and 250 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, you\xe2\x80\x99ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, you\xe2\x80\x99ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves.

Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.

All the Top 20 health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.

Work in your own office, eat delicious food, and travel the world.

We don\xe2\x80\x99t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but\xe2\x80\xa6) You will work in an individual office that will heighten your ability to get stuff done. For lunch, visit King\xe2\x80\x99s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they\xe2\x80\x99re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you\xe2\x80\x99ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyonc\xc3\xa9 concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.

Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.

Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States and home to the state capital and the University of Wisconsin. Madison, a city surrounded by water, has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madison\xe2\x80\x99s first arcade bar.

More than just important work.

We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action (W/M/Vets/Disability) employer. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.

Requirements

Open to relocation to the Madison, WI area (we will bring you here to explore the city for yourself)
BS/BA or greater in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
A history of academic excellence or professional success
Eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship (persons with appropriate qualifications and eligible for TN status under NAFTA may apply)"

title: b'Web Application Developer'
job description:
b"What You Will Be Doing at WebMD
WebMD has updated its entire technology stack and you will be working the latest and most cutting edge technology. We are seeking a motivated, talented and spirited Web Application Developer to join our close-knit team of talented professionals dedicated to building and enhancing WebMD\xe2\x80\x99s next generation product portfolio, to include WebMD\xe2\x80\x99s enterprise web applications and WebMD Mobile. The ideal candidate has diverse experience engineering interactive, responsive, high-traffic web applications within an enterprise setting. We are seeking motivated engineers who are natural leaders to bring a fresh perspective and who thrive in collaborative team settings and want to learn with opportunities to work server-side development. This is a unique opportunity to impact and inspire ground-breaking product ideas with the latest in web technologies.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Be Doing at WebMD
Be part of a collaborative, friendly, and open environment with a team that offers high level exposure.
Work with User Experience team to understand user needs.
Frequently interact with a cross-functional team including product management, development, infrastructure, sales, and services
Develop responsive, multi-screen enterprise web and mobile web applications and APIs using modern web technologies (HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, VueJs, RequireJS)
Project responsibilities include development, testing, documentation, implementation, and maintenance
Actively participate in and contribute to global site architectural discussions and initiatives
Actively contribute to and enforce best practices, group standards
Mentor other developers, including peer reviewing code and pair programming (shadowing)
Proactively keep up-to-date on industry trends and emerging technologies; drive adoption of new technologies and best practices

What's In It For You
Besides a competitive compensation package, you'll be working with a great group of technologists interested in always finding the right tool for the job in a culture that encourages innovation.  If you're ready to take on some new technical challenges at a well-respected company, we'd love to hear from you.
  What You Need For This Position  (minimum qualifications)
3+ years of experience delivering large scale web applications
3+ years of Javascript/HTML/CSS development experience, VueJS is highly preferred.
Experience working with HTML5 APIs (Video/Audio, Local Storage, History, Canvas Animation)
Experience with basic jQuery, including writing modules
Experience developing Responsive, multiscreen (desktop/tablet/mobile) layouts with HTML5/CSS3/VueJS.
Experience programming using RESTful APIs.

... and if you have the following, even better! (preferred qualifications)
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in a technical discipline or equivalent work experience
CommonJS/AMD modules with RequireJS or equivalent
VueJS or another equivalent Javascript framework
Agile development practices: Scrum, Kanban/Lean, test-driven development, continuous integration
Version control software, preferably Git
Section 508 and WCAG accessibility standards
Must provide code samples (examples: URLs with descriptions of which parts you developed, zip file, link to a github.com or equivalent profile)

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b'Join the A.I. company tackling some of the most consequential problems facing the world today. Gro Intelligence is a fast-growing, mission-driven data and analytics company dedicated to understanding the interconnected global markets for all agricultural products. From the food we eat to the clothing we wear and the gasoline in millions of cars across the globe, agriculture touches our daily existence like few other industries. And it\xe2\x80\x99s being completely upended by climate change, trade wars, finite global resources, fickle public policies, a growing population and ever-changing human tastes (e.g. organic produce, plant-based proteins, etc). Come help us understand the complex interplay of these various forces and their ripple effect on global markets.

With offices in both New York and Nairobi, and the financial backing of prominent investors including TPG Growth and Data Collective, Gro is a diverse team of more than 70 technologists, scientists, and business professionals. Our team is growing rapidly and we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for highly motivated, intellectually curious individuals with a shared commitment to building software that impacts the world on the most basic level.

Gro has been featured prominently alongside the company\xe2\x80\x99s founder and CEO in several recent outlets including Recode Decode with Kara Swisher, Fast Company\xe2\x80\x99s Most Creative People, Fortune\xe2\x80\x99s Most Powerful Women in Business, and Vanity Fair\xe2\x80\x99s Inside the Hive with Nick Bilton.

Gro is looking to bring on a web developer to keep building and optimizing Gro\xe2\x80\x99s website. This developer will join us to make our web properties more accessible and successful to serve current customers and attract potential clients.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Create responsive, mobile-friendly web experiences for the gro-intelligence.com website and other Gro web properties.
Write well-designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices.
Work with the Product Managers, UI and UX designers to ensure Gro\xe2\x80\x99s web properties are optimized for high conversions and a delightful user experience.
Integrate with CRMs and inbound marketing systems when necessary for promotional, and informational strategies.
Integrate with web analytics tools to track conversion performance.


What You Have
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science, HCI, Design, or equivalent practical experience
Proficient in HTML5 and CSS3
Experience with web libraries and frameworks, such as jQuery, React, AngularJS
Experience with server-side javascript (e.g Node.js) and frameworks such as Express.js, Hapi.js. Familiar with MVC concept.
Experience using RESTful APIs
Be knowledgeable of best practices for and able to produce high-quality web application UX and UI
Conversant with analytics tools such as HubSpot, Google Analytics, or Mixpanel
2 years related working experience


Bonus Points
Experience with SEO
Experience designing and developing highly interactive web pages
Knowledge of databases such as Postgres, MongoDB
Python, Go, C++, Java
Portfolio is a plus


Gro Intelligence is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.'

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"Who We Are

Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Seamless, HBO, Disney, Urban Outfitters, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale \xe2\x80\x93 each month, tens of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 2 billion active users through Braze.

Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms in 2019. The company has also been named on the Forbes Cloud 100, Inc. Magazine\xe2\x80\x99s 2019 Best Places to Work, and Crain's 2019 Best Places to Work in NYC lists.

What We're Looking For

Braze is looking for a skilled web developer to help grow our MarTech and Ops team. This person will play an integral role in developing and executing on marketing tactics to not only drive revenue, but enrich the web experience for visitors to Braze.com. This role will own the full development lifecycle and continually build and optimize both the frontend and backend of the website.

A key part of the Demand Generation team, you will execute on direct outputs from the marketing strategy and implement strategic iterations to Braze.com in an effort to create better pipeline-driving experiences for our prospects and customers. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a developer that loves to mix their passion for web development with a desire for pushing web analytics and marketing tech to the next level.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Help to lead the transformation of Braze.com\xe2\x80\x99s 2020 new website redesign!
Our CMS is built on Craft and you\xe2\x80\x99ll be creating scalable page templates to leverage in our marketing programs.
Contribute to website development with a highly technical approach around analytics, SEO optimization, and delivery of quality traffic to the website
Test & optimize our site to increase stickiness and increase conversions.
Streamline and build scalable templates for our content management infrastructure to empower the marketing team to use the website
Partner with stakeholders across the organization to scope new web page or section needs and develop a plan for evaluating asks.
Create attention-grabbing experiences by helping to identify emerging trends, and working to implement them as appropriate across our marketing properties.
Manage Google Analytics and set up dashboards and custom events to monitor and analyze site performance and provide recommendations for content updates or areas of optimization.
Leverage optimization and AB testing tools such as Optimizely to regularly test and optimize site. Recommend new tools where appropriate.


Who You Are

You have a deep understanding of what it takes to manage a website including minimizing technical debt, maintaining SEO best practices, and finding the simplest way to achieve complex and high impact problems.
5+ years of experience
Deep expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML5 , CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, PHP, and API's.
Knowledge of Craft CMS and Google Analytics
Comfortable with JavaScript libraries (React, jQuery), JavaScript module loaders (RequireJS), templating languages, Github
Working knowledge of Node, unit testing, a/b testing - we use Optimizely
Strong communicator and experience working on a marketing team
Familiarity in building high performance responsive websites
Prior experience working with professional design teams


What We Offer
Competitive compensation that includes equity
Flexible time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave
Free daily lunch, including snacks and beverages
Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture

In addition, this position is exempt under the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act.

If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights."

title: b'Web Developer (Mid-Level)'
job description:
b'Web Developer (Mid-Level)

Manhattan Prep\xe2\x80\x99s developers create the next-generation technologies which have changed how hundreds of thousands learn, making accessible and useful the Manhattan Prep curriculum and coursework. Our ambitions reach far beyond just test preparation to engineer exceptional learning experiences for millions of future students.

As a Web Developer at Manhattan Prep, you live on the front lines of the education revolution (making quality education accessible to more students) and build features used by thousands of people every day. The work is challenging, fast paced and always changing. Strong analytical skills, unwavering commitment to quality, collaborative work ethic and cutting edge coding skills are all required.

You will be given substantial responsibility with room for professional growth. If you seek a challenging, exciting, and creative programming role \xe2\x80\x94 while working with talented and passionate people \xe2\x80\x94 this might be the position for you. Must work in NYC.

As a Web Developer You Will
Participate in the architecture, design, and implementation of educational applications, products and company business systems.
Work within a team of talented developers to design workflows and mentor team members while setting an example.
Participate in the design and development of new features and products, including requirements gathering, estimating, coding, testing, developing test plans and maintenance schedules.
Communicate status of projects/applications and give accurate data forecasts for projects and work items.
Take initiative in problem solving and demonstrate advanced problem awareness.
Work in an agile environment that facilitates ideation across all product development teams.
Tackle the tough problems of integrating complex systems across internal business units.

Skills & Requirements
5+ years of web development/architecture experience.
Deep experience with Ruby, Javascript and related frameworks.
Experience with object oriented, data-driven design and development.
Familiarity with using a relational and non-relational databases.
Design, develop and maintain new features on existing applications and systems.
Confidence with distributed version control systems (Git).
Develop domain expertise by working closely with dev team and product managers.
Self-motivated, quick learner who can manage multiple projects and developers with minimal direction.

How To Impress Us
Show us a web app you created independently from start to finish.
Show us open source projects you\xe2\x80\x99ve worked on (with tested code).
Show us an awesome portfolio.
Talk to us about how you write clean code.
Talk to us about how you\xe2\x80\x99ve scaled an app.

What We Offer
Competitive Salary, plus individual and company performance bonuses.
Medical, Dental, Life and Disability Insurance.
401K Savings Plan + company matching.
Exciting location and office environment.
Free Employee Prep Class (GMAT, GRE or LSAT).
Family Discount on Manhattan Prep Classes.
An incredible team of smart and supportive people.
And more!

About Manhattan Prep

Manhattan Prep is a fast-growing education organization headquartered in New York City. A market leader in test preparation, Manhattan Prep is the preferred test prep provider for corporate clients including Google, Goldman Sachs, Deloitte, McKinsey, Accenture, and others. We conduct in-person classes and private instruction across the United States, Canada, and the UK, and our Live Online courses, digital learning resources, and print books are available worldwide.'

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
