OPEX Corporation is looking for a full time Developer to work at our World Headquarters in Moorestown, NJ.

Jr. Web Apps Developer

Position Summary

OPEX Corporation is looking for a full time Jr. Developer to work at our World Headquarters in Moorestown, NJ. The developer in this role will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining various applications. The ideal candidate will have a high interest in working on multiple projects at any given time both independently and with other Service group team members.

Responsibilities
Assist in the design, development and support of web applications used by the OPEX Service group
Create web, multimedia and documentation graphics used by the OPEX Service group
Create multimedia modules to support documentation, in-house training and remote web lesson environments
Work with our lead web developer to enhance the look and feel of our existing website and mobile applications
Work on existing applications with enhancements to infrastructure that include; Server side support of mobile applications, on-line distribution of secure documentation, proprietary training and education website
Enhance web portals for management to analyze performance statistics on a variety of service metrics
Write, design, or edit Web page content, or direct others producing content
Collaborate with others to resolve information technology issues

Requirements
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or related experience
1+ years of web or applications development experience is preferred
Experience with PHP, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL and modern browsers.
Experience with Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, and Captivate is a plus
Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio, and or J-developer, Oracle Fusion middleware a plus.
Experience with Oracle a plus
Ability to balance multiple projects concurrently.
Ability to document development including database design, application design and ongoing documentation of changes and modifications.
Strong communication (oral and written), interpersonal and relationship-building skills
Physical/Work Environments
Office setting

Company Overview

OPEX Corporation is a recognized global technology leader in high-speed mailroom automation, document imaging, and material handling. Since 1973, OPEX systems have provided performance enhancing workflow solutions and cost-effective results to thousands of organizations around the world.

From its humble beginnings in a leased warehouse in southern New Jersey, OPEX\xe2\x80\x99s global workforce now has over 800+ employees. OPEX\xe2\x80\x99s Moorestown, New Jersey World Headquarters features more than 475,000 square feet of engineering, manufacturing, warehouse, product assembly and office space. OPEX offices are also located in the U.K., France, Germany and Australia.

Benefits
Full medical, dental and vision with low employee contribution rates
Paid holidays, vacation and personal days
401k with matching and profit sharing
Basic life insurance, short term and long term disability
OPEX Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and protected veteran status.

title: b'Frontend Developer'
job description:
b'We are looking for programmers with a keen eye for design for the position of Front End Developer. Front end Developers are responsible for ensuring the alignment of web design and user experience requirements, optimizing web pages for maximum efficiency and maintaining brand consistency across all web pages, among other duties.
Front End Developers are required to work in teams alongside Back end Developers, Graphic Designers and User Experience Designers to ensure all elements of web creation are consistent. This requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Front End Developer Responsibilities:
Determining the structure and design of web pages.
Ensuring user experience determines design choices.
Developing features to enhance the user experience.
Striking a balance between functional and aesthetic design.
Ensuring web design is optimized for smartphones.
Building reusable code for future use.
Optimizing web pages for maximum speed and scalability.
Utilizing a variety of markup languages to write web pages.
Maintaining brand consistency throughout design.
Front End Developer Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Understanding of key design principles.
Proficiency with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery.
Understanding of server-side CSS.
Experience with graphic design applications such as Adobe Illustrator.
Experience with responsive and adaptive design.
Understanding of SEO principles.
Good problem solving skills.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Good interpersonal skills.'
